intro: Laserpitium elegans, commonly known as the slender grass vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Laserpitium elegans is often found in temperate climates and is valued for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity.
